swap is a format type
you also need a partition for your root (called "/")
I suggest you format as ext4
and if you want, what I normally do is give 50GB to the root and the rest to /home
with swap getting twice my ram
you are installing on a mac?
so do it :-)
make a partition mounted at / that is ext4 and takes up the entire drive
(a GB of swap is not very useful)
unless you plan to run this on machine with very little ram
swap only matters when you run out of ram
and it reduces the life of your flash drive
not unless your machine has under a GB of ram
that is what I would do
actually, less than 2GB I would use swap :-)
